snippet: An order by the French Court of Justice could mean that Ms. Lagarde will be embroiled in a lengthy process to address accusations stemming from a 2007 arbitration case.
abstract: French court orders International Monetary Fund managing director Christine Lagarde to stand trial on charges stemming from controversial 2007 arbitration case she oversaw as French finance minister; lawyers for Lagarde, whose IMF position is at stake, maintain her innocence and will appeal court's decision to bring her to trial.

byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin and Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: An order by the French Court of Justice could mean that Ms. Lagarde will be embroiled in a lengthy process to address accusations stemming from a 2007 arbitration case.

headline.main: I.M.F. Chief Faces Trial in Case Dating to Time as French Finance Minister
headline.print_headline: I.M.F. Chief Faces Trial in Case Dating to Time as Finance Minister of France
